{{title}} {{disambig-two|the scene in [[The Lord of the Rings: The Two Towers]]|city|[[Osgiliath]]}} {{scene | name = Osgiliath | film = [[The Lord of the Rings: The Two Towers]] | image = The Lord of the Rings - The Two Towers - Faramir leads Frodo and Sam to Osgiliath.jpg | number = 44 (theatrical)
55 (extended) | duration = 00:38 (theatrical)
00:34 (extended) | event = Faramir leads Frodo and Sam to [[Osgiliath]]. | characters = [[Faramir]], [[Frodo Baggins|Frodo]], [[Samwise Gamgee|Sam]] | previous = [[Master Peregrin's Plan]] | next = [[The Last March of the Ents]] }} '''Osgiliath''' is the forty-fourth of ''[[The Lord of the Rings: The Two Towers]]'' and the fifty-fifth scene of [[The Lord of the Rings: The Two Towers (extended edition)|''The Lord of the Rings: The Two Towers'' (extended edition)]]. ==Synopsis== [[Faramir]] and the [[Rangers of Ithilien]] lead [[Frodo Baggins|Frodo]] and [[Samwise Gamgee|Sam]] to [[Osgiliath]]. They see smoke rising from the city, signifying it is under attack by the forces of [[Mordor]]. {{blockquote|[[The One Ring|The Ring]] will not save [[Gondor]]. It has only the power to destroy. Please... let me go.|Frodo to Faramir}} Faramir takes his time to consider what Frodo said before deciding to continue forwards to Osgiliath. The scene ends with Frodo pleading with him to be let go. ==Differences== In the book, [[Faramir]] did not take [[Frodo Baggins|Frodo]] and [[Samwise Gamgee|Sam]] to [[Osgiliath]]. When he discovered Frodo was carrying [[The One Ring|the Ring]], he told the two [[Hobbits]] he would not try to take it,{{TT|Window}}, p. 681 and parted with them at [[Henneth Annûn]], where they went towards the [[Morgul Vale]].{{TT|Journey}}, p. 694 {{references}} [[Category:The Lord of the Rings: The Two Towers scenes|55]]
